title: Dynamical Theory for Adaptive Systems
abstract: arXiv:2306.01403v5 Announce Type: replace-cross  Abstract: The study of adaptive dynamics, involving many degrees of freedom on two separated timescales, one for fast changes of state variables and another for the slow adaptation of parameters controlling the former's dynamics is crucial for understanding feedback mechanisms underlying evolution and learning. We present a path-integral approach \`a la Martin-Siggia-Rose-De Dominicis-Janssen (MSRDJ) to analyse nonequilibrium phase transitions in such dynamical systems. As an illustration, we apply our framework to the adaptation of gene-regulatory networks under a dynamic genotype-phenotype map: phenotypic variations are shaped by the fast stochastic gene-expression dynamics and are coupled to the slowly evolving distribution of genotypes, each encoded by a network structure. 标题：适应系统动力理论
摘要：arXiv:2306.01403v5 宣布类型：替换-交叉
摘要：研究包含两种不同时间尺度变化的适应动态学，一种是状态变量的快速变化，另一种是控制前者的参数的缓慢适应性，对于理解驱动进化和学习反馈机制至关重要。我们提出了一种类似马丁-西加亚-罗斯-德多里安茨-扬森（MSRDJ）的路径积分方法，来分析此类动态系统中非平衡相变。作为实例，我们将我们的框架应用于动态基因-表型地图下的基因调控网络适应性：表型变化由快速随机基因表达动态决定，并与遗传型的分布缓慢演化相关联，每个遗传型由网络结构编码。我们证明，在该地图下，互惠反馈回路网络的基因型在环境应答阈值附近被选择。
